```c
void metal_linux_irq_shutdown(void)
{
	int ret;

	metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "%s\n", __func__);
	irq_handling_stop = true;
	metal_linux_irq_notify();
	ret = pthread_join(irq_pthread, NULL);
	if (ret) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to join IRQ thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
	}
	close(irq_notify_fd);
	metal_mutex_deinit(&irq_lock);
}
```

static int metal_linux_irq_notify(void)
{
	uint64_t val = 1;
	int ret;

	ret = write(irq_notify_fd, &val, sizeof(val));
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "%s failed\n", __func__);
	}
	return ret;
}

static void metal_linux_irq_set_enable(struct metal_irq_controller *irq_cntr,
				       int irq, unsigned int state)
{
	int offset, ret;

	if (irq < irq_cntr->irq_base ||
	    irq >= irq_cntr->irq_base + irq_cntr->irq_num) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "%s: invalid irq %d\n",
			  __func__, irq);
		return;
	}
	offset = irq - linux_irq_cntr.irq_base;
	metal_mutex_acquire(&irq_lock);
	if (state == METAL_IRQ_ENABLE)
		metal_bitmap_set_bit(irqs_enabled, offset);
	else
		metal_bitmap_clear_bit(irqs_enabled, offset);
	metal_mutex_release(&irq_lock);
	/* Notify IRQ thread that IRQ state has changed */
	ret = metal_linux_irq_notify();
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR,
			  "%s: failed to notify set %d enable\n",
			  __func__, irq);
	}
}

void metal_linux_bus_finish(void)
{
	struct linux_bus *lbus;
	struct metal_bus *bus;

	for_each_linux_bus(lbus) {
		if (metal_bus_find(lbus->bus_name, &bus) == 0)
			metal_bus_unregister(bus);
	}
}

void metal_finish(void)
{
	if (--_metal.common.ref_count != 0)
		return;

	metal_sys_finish();
	memset(&_metal, 0, sizeof(_metal));
}

explanation:
The fragments above form the shutdown and IRQ-notify call paths and therefore should be investigated for possible direct or indirect recursion: metal_finish -> metal_sys_finish -> metal_linux_irq_shutdown -> metal_linux_irq_notify, and other code that calls metal_linux_irq_notify (e.g. metal_linux_irq_set_enable). Other code in the provided snippets and typical library calls do not need investigation for MISRA Rule 17.2 because they do not introduce call-back paths to these shutdown/notify functions:

- Standard library / OS calls (write, pthread_join, close) are external primitives and do not call back into the shown functions in this codebase.
- Helper functions shown or referenced but not included as suspicious (metal_log, metal_mutex_acquire/release/deinit, metal_bitmap_set_bit/clear_bit, metal_bus_find, metal_bus_unregister, for_each_linux_bus) are simple utilities or external APIs with no evidence in the provided code that they call back into metal_linux_irq_shutdown/metal_linux_irq_notify or form part of a call cycle.

Investigation should therefore focus on the listed fragments to determine whether any runtime/thread interactions or other functions (not shown) create an indirect recursion (for example, whether the IRQ thread or any function reachable from metal_linux_irq_notify can call back into metal_linux_irq_shutdown or metal_sys_finish).
